Description: Blade of a flint knife, worked both sides with bifacial retouch all round. Leaf-shaped with pointed top, while butt end is slightly blunter with less regular retouch.
Curator's comments: Published: G Brunton and G Caton-Thompson, The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (British School of Archaeology in Egypt 46, 1928) , 3, pl. XXVI R Friedman 'Badari Grave Group 569' in W. V. Davies (ed), Studies in Egyptian Antiquities: A Tribute to T. G. H. James (BM Occasional Paper 123, 1999), 3, fig. 1; colour pl. I
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. XXVI)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
